The *Scripture of the Nine Heavens for Turning Back to Heaven* states: The August Emperor of Highest Sagacity said: "Among those who study the Dao and have their names recorded in the mysterious registers, whose bodies bear the marks of immortality, there are those who naturally align with the Perfected—yet they suffer the Seven Harms that lead to defeat.

The first harm: donning the true while practicing the false, indulging in lust and dissipating the spirit. The *hun*-soul’s fluids leak away, the radiance of essence withers, qi scatters, the *po*-soul scatters, the bones hollow, the form decays, the spirit weeps in the exhausted palace. This is heard in the Celestial Pass, the Perfected Immortals flee far away, demonic spirits approach to trouble one. One binds oneself to the nine hells, befriends the Six Heavens, and sinks into boundless suffering. How can one still attain immortality?

The second harm: outwardly, the form preserves the Dao, the skin appears refined, and one professes devotion to the true, yet the heart harbors yin thieves. Malice and wickedness accumulate within, wishing others ill and failure, envying the capable and resenting the worthy. The mouth speaks fair words, but the heart is perverse; the face smiles, but the heart seethes. One disputes over gains and losses, recklessly creates the roots of sin, slanders fellow students, and attacks the foundation of the teacher. The Three Officials record this, marking one as an evil portal. The Perfected Immortals flee far away, while demonic spirits assail the body. One becomes a wandering shadow, the flying form scatters the spirit. Thus, one suffers unjust hardships, exhausting the roots of evil. When the reckoning is complete, the form turns to ash and sinks into oblivion. Though one bears a name in the mysterious registers, how can one preserve the natural?

The third harm: drinking wine to the point of utter intoxication, harming qi and losing the numinous. The five palaces collapse, the myriad spirits are startled, the *hun* and *po* scatter and fly away, the inner and outer decay and crumble. The original chamber is left empty and desolate, the Red Child wails in sorrow. The Perfected Immortals flee far away, while demonic spirits enter the form. Such a student vainly wastes essence and sincerity. Though one may have a name in the mysterious registers, it is but an empty loss of the jade name. The spirit ascends to the upper palace, while the body turns to ash in the dark underworld. In a state of confusion, seeking long life—how can one endure?

The fourth harm: conduct that does not benefit others, demanding reverence from others, the heart filled with anger, the mouth engaged in constant quarrels and curses. Joy and wrath lack moderation, the temperament is contrary and unsteady. Qi surges, the spirit scatters, the inner Perfected flees, the *po* departs, the *hun* vanishes, the nine orifices fill with dust, the five palaces rush to ruin. All this stems from the impure nature and the inauspicious conduct. The Perfected Immortals flee far away, while external ailments enter the form. With such a path of study, what can one hope for? Though one may possess the mysterious chart, one cannot escape this calamity. The day of attaining immortality grows distant, while the path to the underworld lengthens.

The fifth harm: though one may outwardly display the mysterious chart and receive precious scriptures, or encounter a numinous teacher who imparts sacred texts, one does not follow the regulations and covenants, leaking the celestial Perfected. Before completing nine years of submitting one’s name to the famous mountains, ensuring that the Azure Palace has a record and the Golden Portal compiles a register, one transmits these to others, scattering them among the world. To treat the true lightly and leak the precious brings reckoning upon oneself. Though one may bear a name in the mysterious registers, it only burdens the Seven Mysteries. The Dao of immortality flees far away, the body dies and descends to the dark springs, forever bearing the responsibility of ghosts, never to be released for ten thousand kalpas."

Sixth Harm: Treading through filth and defilement, body and shadow reek unpleasantly. Within, there is no purity or emptiness; without, no orchid’s fragrance. Turbid darkness loses the true, spirits do not dwell in their chambers. Qi is disturbed, essence confounded, the numinous origin loses its radiance. The Five Spirits scatter and flee, the Red Child soars away. Demonic forces assail, inner and outer both perish. In such study, hope for attainment brings only harm. The Perfected Immortals ascend far away, leaving but an empty shadow to wander alone, sinking into murk and chaos—how can immortality be hoped for?

Seventh Harm: Consuming the flesh of the six livestock, slaughtering to sate the palate with rich flavors. Foul vapors fill the viscera, cutting short life in forms not one’s own. True qi is disturbed at the numinous pass, the wandering spirit startles the Red Child. Hun and po depart from their palaces, turbid weeping clings to mouth and teeth. The Perfected Immortals ascend high to Jade Clarity, while one’s own body sinks and lingers in the earthly realm. Though bearing a name in the Emperor’s mysterious register, one still cannot escape inevitable death.

The Eight Difficulties
The *Lingbao Zhenyi Ziran Jingjue* states: The Dao says: For kings, lords, Daoist masters, and common folk to be born as humans, forsaking the female form to become male—this is difficult.
Having become male, possessing keen intelligence and far-reaching wisdom, the six emotions intact, form and appearance upright and majestic, voice like jade tones, qi like renowned incense, eyes radiant as sunlight, delighting all who behold—yet still feeling the mysterious as insufficient—this is difficult.
Having fulfilled all virtues, being born in a land of the Dao, where ruler and father are wise and deeply esteem the Way—this is difficult.
Being poor yet devoted to the Dao, unceasing in thoughts of kindness and generosity—this is difficult.
Being wealthy and noble yet believing in and revering Daoist masters, honoring and serving the scriptures without negligence—this is difficult.
Being able to endure others’ malice without contention, mastering life and preventing decay, attaining transcendence and the immortal Dao—this is difficult.
Encountering the precious scriptures of the Three Caverns—*Dongzhen*, *Dongxuan*, and *Dongshen*—and upholding, reciting, and making offerings to them with incense—this is difficult.
Meeting a Perfected Immortal or Sage who expounds the teachings, and finding like-minded companions—this is difficult.
These are the Eight Difficulties.

The *Zhongzhen Jie Jing* states: The Perfected Lord of the Western City declared: For one to depart the Three Evil Paths and be born as a human—this is difficult.
The commentary to this scripture explains: The Three Evil Paths mean not being born as a human, but as birds, beasts, insects, or livestock—these are the Three Evil Paths.
Having been born as a human, forsaking the female form to become male—this is difficult.
Having become male, possessing intact six emotions and four limbs—this is difficult.
With the six emotions intact, being born in the Central Kingdom—this is difficult.
Living in the Central Kingdom and encountering a ruler, parents, or sovereign who upholds the Dao—this is difficult.
Having encountered a sovereign who upholds the Dao, being born to study the Dao with a compassionate, benevolent, and virtuous heart—this is difficult.
With a virtuous heart awakened, believing in the Dao and the virtue of longevity—this is difficult.
Having believed in the Dao and virtue, being born in an era of Great Peace—this is most difficult.
How can one not be exhorted!

The Seven Perils
The *Ben Yuan Da Jie Jing* states: The Perfected One said: The peril lies in being born into the human realm yet failing to cultivate virtue and nurture one’s nature to preserve life.
The peril lies in hearing the scriptures yet failing to believe them.
The peril lies in receiving the scriptures yet failing to recite and expound them, or to practice their teachings.
The peril lies in failing to cultivate the body.
The peril lies in taking medicinal herbs yet growing weary before they take effect.
The peril lies in the Dao’s practices being incomplete yet boasting of seeking ascension.
The peril lies in retreating to secluded mountains to read scriptures in quietude yet being unable to endure the hardships.
These seven perils reside within the person. If one does not guard against them, the body cannot be saved. Thus it is said: The greatest peril befalls my own self—this is what it means.
How can one not reflect! How can one not reflect!

The Five Corruptions

The *Scripture of the Purple Texts of the Numinous Book* states:

**First Corruption:** When a person indulges in licentiousness, ghostly fluids leak outward, essence and radiance wither and deplete, the hun and po scatter in scorched disarray, bones grow frail and marrow turns foul. The hun wails in the numinous palace, its cries ascending to the Jade Tower. The Three Palaces contend in turmoil, the embryonic flower grieves in confusion—this is the first corruption of the immortal’s appearance.

**Second Corruption:** Refrain from consuming the flesh of the six livestock, for it causes the body’s qi to stagnate and reek, the spirit to grow turbid and sluggish. The face turns sallow, the teeth wither, the spleen nurtures dead qi, the hun cannot receive the true, and the po breeds perverse rebellion. The body sinks into the abyss, bones buried in earth—this is the second corruption of the immortal’s appearance.

**Third Corruption:** Refrain from eating the five pungent vegetables, for they make the five viscera reek with foulness, the Three Flowers dissolve in chaos. The spirit cannot ascend, the essence-womb descends into ruin, the hun and po part ways, the Red Child grows restless and weary, the Flying Spirit loses its guard, and the luminous radiance scatters in flight—this is the third corruption of the immortal’s appearance.

**Fourth Corruption:** Refrain from killing living creatures, for above, it invites karmic retribution from the myriad beings. Blood flows from bound limbs, the form is exposed, the po perishes, the hun’s qi wages war, the embryonic spirit wanders in distress, the Infant flees in terror, the Mud Pill Palace turns treacherous and wild, the Red Child abandons and betrays. The corpse is cast into the boiling cauldron, boiled to a pulpy ruin—this is the fourth corruption of the immortal’s appearance.

**Fifth Corruption:** Do not relieve oneself facing north, nor gaze upward at the Three Luminaries. Do not cut hair or remove clothing facing north. Do not spit or curse facing north, lest you violate and destroy the King—"destroy" refers to the earthly branch of the year.

The *Scripture of the True Regulations of the Most High* states: The Most High Lord of the Dao said: Demon kings and perverse spirits are all demoted, and even if they are allowed to act again, they are still called "residual qi."

**Hunting**
The *Dao De Jing* of Lord Lao states: Galloping and hunting stir the heart to madness.

The *Scripture of Illuminating the True Regulations* states: In the boundless world, men and women born without the Dao, unmindful of good causes, hunt in the three spring months, unleashing hounds and falcons, setting snares and nets, burning mountains, stabbing and shooting wild beasts, slaughtering living beings. Their crimes are heinous and perverse; in death, they bear heavy calamities. Their bodies bear iron rods, myriad pains assail them, driven through a hundred realms, with no rest in eating or sleeping. The suffering of their dead souls is unbearable. For ten thousand kalpas, they are reborn as wild beasts, constantly burned and hacked to repay past enmities. Even if they return to the human realm, they are always met by evil people, their bodies enduring whippings and beatings, afflicted by sorrow and distress. The path of blessing grows ever distant, entanglements deepen day by day. They cannot attain liberation, bound in eternal night.

The *Scripture of Ascending the Mystery* states: Master Dao Ling’s verse says:
*Those who do not cultivate a compassionate heart,*
*But hunt and kill living beings,*
*Will ultimately face karmic retribution—*
*Flames will scorch their forms.*

**Fishing and Trapping**
The *Scripture of the Original Beginning’s Wisdom, Right Contemplation, and Liberation* states: The Heavenly Worthy said: Some are reborn to make fishing and trapping their livelihood, damming rivers and breaching channels, casting nets and dangling lines, employing every means to harm aquatic life. They boil, roast, butcher, and mince, seeking to sate their bodies, or peddle their catch for profit. Such people, upon death, enter hell, where they receive retribution according to their deeds—enduring cauldrons, knife mountains, and sword trees, facing all manner of suffering. They are reborn as beasts to repay past debts. If they regain human form, their lives are short and fraught with afflictions. Those who personally kill, instruct others to kill, or purchase life with money—if their hearts rejoice in it, it is called killing, and the sin is no different.

**Cruelty**
The *Scripture of Illuminating the True Regulations* states: In the boundless world, men and women born into the world act with malice as their first impulse, inflicting boundless cruelty, slandering the loyal and good. In death, they face evil retribution, reborn with ox heads and beastly bodies, tormented day and night with unspeakable agony. Their bodies rot and disintegrate, losing all human form. For ten thousand kalpas, they are reborn in the frontier lands, possessing human shape but not human nature, forever cut off from the human realm, eternally mired in the gates of sin. They drift through the Five Sufferings and Eight Adversities, unable to attain liberation, bound for countless kalpas without return.

The *Verses of the Flying Celestials* say:
*Those who cruelly harm the loyal and good,*
*Slander and strike the worthy,*
*Are born in frontier lands in life,*
*And in death, take the forms of oxen and beasts.*

**Licentious Sacrifices**
The *Scripture of the Orthodox Unity True Person’s Exposition of the Thousand Illuminations* states: Sacrificing to spirits not one’s own is called licentious sacrifice, which ensnares one in a host of perverse forces.

The *Scripture of the Most High’s True Regulations* states: The Most High Lord of the Dao said: Demon kings and hideous spirits are all demoted, and even if they are allowed to act again, they are still called "residual qi." Residual qi brings disaster, harming the multitudes. The multitudes, failing to awaken, join their ranks, slaughtering living beings and drumming in dance. They chant and sing in sacrifice, terrifying one another, craving the scent of blood and flesh, their offerings strewn in chaos. Their sins accumulate day by day.

The *Scripture of Illuminating the True Regulations* states: In the boundless world, men and women born into the world act with malice and perversity. They slaughter living beings in licentious sacrifices, praying to perverse spirits, singing and dancing in demonic revelry, calling themselves "aunt" and "lord," devouring the common folk, building without reason. Their filth fills and their sins are fixed. In death, they face evil retribution, their hun and po imprisoned, drifting through the Three Offices and Five Peaks, tormented thrice daily with unspeakable agony. For ten thousand kalpas, they are reborn among the lowly, or afflicted with the Six Extremes, taking inhuman forms. They sink into the abyss of sin, bound in eternal night, unable to attain liberation, with no affinity for the path of blessing.

The *Verses of the Flying Celestials* say:
*Those who curse the innocent,*
*Dance in licentious sacrifice to perverse spirits,*
*Drift through the Three Prisons,*
*And for ten thousand kalpas, are reborn in lowly bodies.*

**Treason**
The *Scripture of Illuminating the True Regulations* states: In the boundless world, men and women born into the world commit acts such as killing their lords and fathers, plotting against their masters, destroying scriptures and teachings, and defiling the heavenly perfected. In death, they face evil retribution, their bodies cast into boiling cauldrons, their five limbs boiled to pulp, losing all human form. They are drenched in the juices of a hundred poisons, their pain unbearable, their suffering intolerable. For ten thousand kalpas, they are reborn among the six livestock, or as lowly people afflicted with deafness, blindness, and the six illnesses, taking inhuman forms, subject to being killed or kept alive by others to repay past enmities. The path of blessing grows ever more distant, the roots of sin deepen daily. They cannot attain liberation, eternally lost without return.

The *Feitianren Jiegong* states:
*"Plotting against and harming one’s lords and fathers,
Defiling and destroying the heavenly perfected.
In death, one is cast into boiling cauldrons,
Suffering pain without hope of return."*

The *Taiping Scripture* teaches:
*"All people who incur blame and retribution
Do so because they fail to cultivate their own virtue and discipline,
Lose the proper order of things,
And thus bear the burden of their transgressions.
For instance, if parents act immorally or wrongly toward their neighbors,
Their descendants may later be harmed by those same neighbors—
This is the clearest example of bearing the burden of past deeds.

Now, when ancient sovereigns ruled without aligning with the will of Heaven and Earth,
It was not merely that one person disrupted the cosmic order.
Heaven grows enraged and displeased,
So countless calamities arise,
And their successors inherit the blame.

Thus, the great sages of antiquity all knew the Way of self-cultivation,
And so their governance was harmonious, with few bearing the burden of misrule.

Later, the teachers of the world
Concealed the true teachings of the Dao,
Spreading instead superficial and ornate doctrines,
Going against the natural order of Heaven.
They caused later generations to be shallow and incapable of true self-cultivation and benevolence,
And over time, this led them to stray far from the Dao,
Believing no method could preserve them—
Thus, they suffered the disasters of inherited retribution.

Consider the great tree of the southern mountains:
Its branches stretch wide, covering hundreds of paces,
While its upper limbs bear countless fruits and blossoms of boundless worth.
But its roots are weak,
And when struck by great winds, all its branches, fruits, and blossoms are shattered and die.
This is the great fault of all things—plants and trees—

Thus, disasters never ceased, passed down through generations, accumulating into greater wickedness. Their harm grew profound, spawning anomalies and omens, continuing without end, bringing misfortune to all nations. Their source is truly distant.

Rulers, unaware, perpetuate this cycle, unable to restrain it. The people cry out in injustice, lamenting the movements of Heaven’s agents. The **true Dao/Way** loses its path, governance is impaired, auspicious responses grow rare, human intentions impure—making education even more difficult. The **perverse *qi*** stirs within, and though emperors grieve, their hearts long to halt it, like a thirsty man unable to quench his thirst. What then?

Even if the **Five Sovereigns** possess the benevolence of ten thousand people, they still cannot stop it—this is the **inherited disaster** of past rulers. Thus, they mistakenly conclude that **practicing virtue brings no benefit**, that **Heaven’s ways are ignorant**. They forbid people from evil, yet despair at their inability to reform them. Instead, they resort to mutual suppression and slaughter, hastening their punishments. When one person errs, their neighbors are implicated, bearing the weight of unjust retribution. The accumulation of evil *qi* grows ever more severe, doubling daily. They abandon the **Dao/Way of virtue** and the scriptures as useless, neglecting them entirely. This is the **chaotic governance** that disrupts Heaven’s order—how could such rule align with the **Heavenly Sovereign’s** will? Heaven has long been afflicted by this.

The evidence is clear: **yin** and **yang** lose their proper course. When governance wins Heaven’s favor, then perversity can be eradicated, and rule becomes easy. The inherited disasters of past rulers, though accumulated, can be easily removed in a single day. The **Primordial Five Qi** (元始五气),
ever at the **Rooster’s Crow** (鸡呜),
ascend to the **Upper Hall of Lingbao Mountain’s Mysterious Capital** (灵宝玉山玄都上宫).
When **yang light first brightens** (阳光初明),
it disperses the **Primordial Radiance** (元始之晖),
pouring through all the heavens—
its movement circulates like a **wheel in motion** (车之轮),
ascending to **command the Nine Heavenly Gates** (九天之关),
consolidating the **Sacred Mountains of the Five Emperors** (五帝灵山),
and descending to **root the Five Clouds of the Aspirants** (学士五牙之根).
The **saints and sages of the Upper Hall** (上宫众圣),
greatly wise **True Persons** (大智真人),
all consume its radiance at this hour,
**tilting upward to swallow its essence** (仰咽其精),
thus harmonizing with the heavens,
and attaining boundless longevity.

The Dao instructs:
*"The method of **guiding and drawing the cloud-tooth** (导引餐牙),
ever on the **eight seasonal days** (八节之日),
each aspirant shall enter their chamber
and **meditate on the Five Elders’ forms** (存思五老形像).
After reciting the incantation,
they shall **follow their respective directions** (各随方导引),
**consuming the qi of the heavens** (服诸天气).
If practiced for **eight years** (八年),
**celestial officials shall arrive at their dwelling** (仙官到房),
**jade maidens shall attend as sentinels** (玉女侍卫),
their body shall **emit luminous light** (身生光明),
illuminating the **ten directions** (十方).
In their **comings and goings** (出入游行),
the **Five Emperors shall bow in homage** (五帝稽首),
and the **Three Realms’ officials shall escort them** (三界司迎)."

The *Èrshísì Shēng Tú Jīng* states:
*"Above, there is the **Qi of Immortality** (不死气),
which **cultivates the cloud-tooth and refines the Five Immortals** (殖牙练五仙).
Within the **Jade Cauldron of the Mysterious Middle** (玉芝玄中澳),
the body grows **pure and naturally fragrant** (体洁自生熏).
When **high-spirited essence descends** (精思高灵降),
they **mingle with the Sovereigns of the Five Directions** (交游上帝君).
**To consume the Yellow Qi** (服黄气)...»

The *Tàiqīng Yuánjūn Zhōng Jīng* states:
*"The **Divine Immortal Diagram** (神仙图) says:
The **Supreme Saints consume the Yellow** (上圣食黄),
the **Worthy Ones consume the Primordial** (贤者食元).
The **method of consuming the Yellow** (食黄之道):
**Uppermost, contemplate the Central Extremity** (上念中极),
which is the **spleen’s Yellow Person** (乃脾上黄人),
three inches in length,
with two hands also each containing a **Yellow Person** (黄人).
When the **Yellow Qi ascends** (黄气上升),
one shall **perceive their spirit** (即见其神),
slowly utter the incantation:
**‘Yellow Constant One, Yellow Constant One,
the True Person of the Yellow Court is within me.**
For me, take the **five-colored elixir-cauldron herbs** (五色丹芝草),
and all that may be **drunk or eaten** (诸可饮食者),
swallow them **three times, five times, and cease** (急咽之三五而止)—
then one shall be **sated** (即饱矣),
**plump, lusterous, and prolonged in years** (肥泽延年)."

The *Lǎojūn Guān Fú Tàiqīng Zhōng Jīng* states:
*"The **Divine Immortal Scripture** (神仙经) says:
**‘Ever contemplate the Yellow Qi rising from the spleen** (常念脾中黄气上升至口中),
**swallowing it three times, five times, and cease** (咽之三五而止),
then one shall be **sated** (则饱矣).
This can **ward off grains** (可以辟谷),
**sitting while others perish, standing while others die** (坐在立亡)."
The Master says:
**‘Ever think upon the spleen containing a Great Sun** (常思脾中有大日),
within which is a **Yellow Golden Treasury** (日中有黄金匮),
and within the treasury, a **scroll sealed with a Yellow Golden Seal** (匮中有书),
the seal **three inches broad and long** (广纵三寸),
inscribed with the character: **‘威嬉’** (Wēixī).
When one **focuses their mind and contemplates it deeply** (精而思之),
the **vision shall reach its limit** (穷则目出),
and the **omens shall manifest for reading** (兆能见而读之).
If the **heart opens and the eyes grow clear** (心开目明),
then one shall **attain the Divine Immortals** (则得神仙矣)."

**‘Ever contemplate the Yellow Central Field of the Stomach** (常念胃黄田中正),
white as **congealed fat** (凝脂),
within which the **Yellow Qi fills completely** (中有黄气填满),
rising to the mouth—
**swallowing it shall bring satiety** (上至口中，咽之即饱矣)."
The Master says:
*"The **Yellow Central Field of the Stomach** (胃黄田) is the **Grand Granary** (太仓).
All the **spirits gather within the Granary** (诸神皆来就太仓中食饮),
where there is a **Yellow Golden Stove, Pot, and Winnowing Basket** (黄金灶釜甑).
**Jade Maidens and Jade Boys oversee its operations** (玉女玉童主使令),
thus it is called **‘Yellow Constant One’** (黄常子).
This is the **culmination of the kitchen’s art** (致行厨矣).
**To consume the Sovereign’s Qi** (服王气)..."

*«The* **Laozi’s Scripture of the Embryonic Dao** (《老君胎中经》) *declares:*
**The Way of Naturally Abstaining from Grains** (自然绝谷之道) **— eternal life and prolonged years.**
**In spring,** one **harnesses the Essence of the Teeth** (承牙精),
**in summer,** the **Luminous Elixir of the Moon** (月灵),
**in autumn,** the **Revered Bright Dew** (明露),
**in winter,** the **Mysterious Essence** (玄精).
**A full cycle of three hundred and sixty days** (回岁一浃三百六十),
**with twelve phases** (四九转移十二) **completed in succession—**
**thus the five colors align in their due order** (从其方面), **distinct yet recurring without end.**
**The Dao is fully realized.** (道毕矣)

**The method of abstaining from grains** (绝谷之法):
**A full meal** (饱饭) **should not exceed twelve servings** (不过十二食),
**daily reducing one meal** (日减一餐) **until completion** (讫),
**on the eleventh day, reducing to eleven meals** (十一日减十一餐),
**leaving but one meal** (余有一餐), **halved and diminished** (分半减之),
**until the eighteenth day, when it is fully abandoned.** (讫十八日尽矣)
Though the **intestines are empty** (肠中虽空),
**the Qi of grains remains** (故有谷气).
**Sit upright and align with the Sovereign’s Qi** (正坐随王所在),
**stretch your hands and grasp the Qi** (舒手持气),
**tilt your head back and draw it upward** (仰头引气),
**then swallow it** (咽之) **— slow and deliberate** (安徐细意),
**guiding the Qi downward into the Stomach’s passage** (导气下入胃管),
**so the abdomen resounds with fullness.** (腹中立鸣)

**Nine times upward, nine times downward** (凡九上九下),
**the abdomen swells with great satiety** (腹因大饱),
**yet the mind must remain steady** (定心勿躁),
**for if the True Qi does not descend** (即真气不导),
**and the false Qi enters instead** (邪气中入),
**the result shall be poor.** (即不佳矣)

**By the twelfth day,** the **form grows light and agile** (形体轻便),
**by the eighteenth day,** the **Way is slightly perfected** (道小成),
**by the twenty-seventh day,** the **Way is moderately perfected** (道中成),
**by the thirty-sixth day,** the **Way is greatly perfected** (道大成),
**by the eighty-first day,** the **head and face radiate with light** (头面有光),
**by the one hundred and twentieth day,** the **Way is fully realized.** (其道备矣)
**The Original Qi is firmly established** (元气大定),
**and one becomes a True Person.** (仍是真人也)

*«The* **Supreme Scripture of the Eight Essences of Reality** (《太上八素真经》) *declares:*
**Always maintain purity and clarity** (常当清丽), **burning incense** (烧香),
**enter your chamber and lie facing south** (入室首南正卧),
**separate yourself from others** (断隔人物),
**block all extraneous thoughts** (杜绝他想).
**Close your eyes and gather the Qi** (临目闭气),
**knock your teeth together twenty-four times** (叩齿二十四通),
**retain the One in meditation** (存一如法),
**then visualize the* **Eight Trigrams** (八卦) *in their proper places:*
**Li** (离) *above the head* (在头上),
**Kan** (坎) *below the navel* (在脐下),
**Kun** (坤) *in the left palm* (在左手中),
**Xun** (巽) *in the right palm* (在右手中),
**Zhen** (震) *below the left foot* (在左足下),
**Gen** (艮) *below the right foot* (在右足下),
**Dui** (兑) *at the left ribs* (在左肋),
**Xian** (乾) *at the right ribs* (在右肋).

**The Eight Trigrams embody their forms** (八卦有象),
**within which the Qi resides** (象中有气),
**and within the Qi, the spirits dwell** (气中有神).
**The spirits of the True Person shine brightly** (神人光明),
**manifesting in all eight directions** (备列八方),
**as one exhales the Vital Qi** (口吐生气),
**filling the void of emptiness and space** (因满虚空),
**then dispersing after a time** (分良久).
**The Fire Qi** (火) *transforms in each season:*
**In summer,** **Li** *the Sovereign Qi generates Earth* (离王生土),
**in autumn,** **Dui** *the Sovereign Qi generates Water* (兑王生水),
**in winter,** **Kan** *the Sovereign Qi generates Wood* (坎王生木).

**The four seasons are governed by Qian and Kun** (四季乾坤),
**while Gen and Xun reign supreme** (艮巽王也).
**Their operations follow the moon’s revolutions** (其行者今依月回转).
**Xun governs the third month** (巽三月),
**Kun the sixth month** (坤六月),
**Zhen the ninth month** (轧九月),
**Gen the twelfth month** (艮十二月).

**The method of swallowing the Eight Qi** (咽八气法):
**Draw them through the nose** (以鼻取之),
**extending the breath fully** (极气则已),
**then swallow them subtly** (微微咽之).
**In the month of the Tiger and Rabbit** (寅卯之月), **swallow the Xian Qi** (噏震气),
**three breaths taken, three swallows** (三取三咽止);
**then drink the Li Qi** (次饮离气),
**nine breaths taken, nine swallows** (九取九咽止);
**in the next season, swallow the Xun Qi** (次季噏巽气),
**four breaths taken, four swallows** (四取四咽止);
**then swallow the Kun Qi** (次噏坤气),
**two breaths taken, two swallows** (二取二咽止);
**then swallow the Zhen Qi** (次噏轧气),
**six breaths taken, six swallows** (六取六咽止);
**then swallow the Gen Qi** (次噏艮气),
**eight breaths taken, eight swallows** (八取八咽止);
**then swallow the Dui Qi** (次噏兑气),
**seven breaths taken, seven swallows** (七取七咽止);
**finally, swallow the Kan Qi** (次噏坎气),
**one breath taken, one swallow** (一取一咽止).

**When complete,** knock your teeth together **thirty-six times** (叩齿三十六通),
**then massage and knead your face, ears, neck, and limbs** (摩熨面耳项至四支五体),
**repeating this until the extremities are fully warmed.** (周匝小极)

**At the time of practice,** one must **maintain a three- or six-hour fast** (清斋三时六时),
**offer prayers and supplications** (礼拜启愿),
**adjusting urgency to moderation** (缓急取中),
**according to what the person can bear.** (适人所堪)

**The Method of the Six Steels** (服六戊):
**The practice of Qi-Swallowing** (服气法) *declares:*
**Always begin at dawn and dusk** (常以朝暮),
**starting from the first heavenly stem-branch** (先从甲子起),
**and continuing through* **Jiazi, Yihou, Bingyin, Dingmao, and Wuchen** (续甲子、乙丑、丙寅、丁卯、戊辰止).
**Facing the hour of the Dragon** (向辰),
**knock the* **Golden Beam** (金梁) *— the tongue** (舌也) *—*
**against the* **Jade Ring** (玉瑛) *— the teeth** (齿也),
**refine the* **Flowering Pool** (华池),
**and continue with the* **Liquor Spring** (醴泉).
**Scrape the* **Pool of the Elixir** (丹池) *with your lips,*
**draw the* **Soulful Saliva** (灵液) *from the* **Pool of the Elixir** (唾也),
**swirling it in your mouth three times** (周旋至三),
**then swallow it once** (而一咽).
**Five swallows complete the practice.** (其五咽止)

**Next, continue through* **Jiaxu, Yihai, Bingzi, Dingchou, and Wuyin** (更续甲戌、乙亥、丙子、丁丑、戊寅止).
**Facing the hour of the Tiger** (向寅),
**consume food and drink as in the first method** (饮食如初一法),
**until the sixth Jia** (下竟六甲),
**totaling thirty swallows.** (凡三十咽)
**Swallow their essence** (咽其精华),
**for this is the key principle of the* **Three-Five Method of Consumption** (饮食三五之法要).

**The Method of the Three Lights** (服三光):
*«The* **Scripture of the Hollow Cavity’s Sacred Scrolls** (《空洞灵章经》) *declares:*
**At dawn, consume the Five Lights of the Vital Qi** (朝餐五灵气),
**at dusk, swallow the Three Morning Lights.** (夕噏三晨光)
*«The* **Scripture of the Twenty-Four Generations’ Diagram** (《二十四生图经》) *declares:*
**The Great Dao is subtly formless** (大道妙无像),
**and the movement of Qi condenses the Highest Reality.** (运气凝高真)
**The Void naturally generates** (结空自然生),
**while Xian transforms the two spirits externally.** (震化表二神)
**At dawn, draw the Five Stars’ Essence** (朝引五星精),
**at midday, swallow the* **Midday Elixir** (日中津),
**at dusk, consume the Yellow Moon’s Luster** (夕食黄月华),
**and in sleep, cultivate the Five Immortals.** (寝卧练五仙)
**The shifting scenery adapts to the Void’s transformation** (变景随空化),
**suddenly returning to its natural state.** (倏欻立自然)

*«The* **Scripture of the Five Symbols** (《五符经》) *declares:*
**Consuming the Sun’s Essence** (食日之精) **shall ensure the child’s longevity.** (子必长生)
**For the Sun ascends to the heavens** (缘以上天谒元先),
**always on the first, third, fifth, seventh, ninth, and fifteenth days of the month** (常以月一日、三日、五日、七日、九日、十五日),
**from sunrise until noon** (日出时至日中), **one consumes it.**
**First, visualize within the heart** (先念心中有日):
**the Sun has a Mysterious Canopy** (日中有玄盖),
**beneath which stands a small child** (盖下有小童).
**Thus, the red Qi pervades the body** (故赤气遍身中身外九重),
**filling the nine layers within and without** (思气满头),
**and the Qi of contemplation crowns the head** (从顶出上升天日),
**then spirals around the Sun in nine layers.** (绕日九重)

**The incantation reads:**
*"O Sun Lord, Original Yang!*
**Return to the Vermilion Palace** (还归绛宫),
**and merge with me in virtue** (与我合德),
**together nurturing the small child."** (俱养小童)

**Then, visualize the Sun’s Essence descending** (因思日精来下),
**entering through the nasal passages at the crown** (入顶鼻孔中).
**Swallow it three times nine** (咽之三九满心中),
**until the heart is full.**
**Within the heart are three figures** (心中有三人):
**the left is* **Taiyi the Father** (太一父也),
**the right is* **Xuan Guang the Mother** (玄光母也),
**and the central one is* **the Crimson Infant, the small child** (赤子小童也).
**He sits upon a* **Golden Bed and Jade Couch** (坐金床玉榻),
**holding a* **Jade Basin and Jade Cup** (执玉盘玉杯),
**within which is* **the Divine Jade Flower Elixir** (杯中玉英神酒),
**alongside the* **Heavenly Cushion Grass** (并天芝草).
**One sees them consuming food and drink** (见在饮食之),
**yet never feels hunger or thirst** (仍不饥渴),
**and thus attains eternal life.** (而长生矣)

**Consuming the Moon’s Essence** (食月之精) **shall also ensure longevity.** (可以长生)
**For the Moon ascends to the heavens** (缘之以上天),
**always on the fifteenth night of the month** (常以月十五日夜半时),
**facing the Moon** (向月),
**one kneels twice and recites the incantation:**
*"O Moon Lord, Child of Light!*
**Return to the Elixir Field** (还归丹田),
**and merge with me in virtue** (与我合德),
**together nurturing the small child."** (俱养小童)

**Then, visualize the Moon’s white Qi and yellow Essence descending** (因思月光白气黄精来下),
**entering through the nasal and oral passages** (入鼻口中).
**Swallow it three times seven** (咽之三七而止),
**until completion.**
**The Moon’s Essence sustains the kidney root for eternal life.** (月精托肾根长生矣)

**Consuming the Stars’ Essence** (食星之精) **shall elevate one to* **Supreme Purity** (上升太清).
**Always at sunrise, mid-morning, noon, and midnight** (常以日出、晡时、日中、夜半),
**one meditates upon* **the Grand Sovereign Star of the Northern Pole** (上念北极太皇星),
**and recites the incantation:**

---

**To the Grand Sovereign of Heaven, the Supreme Dao Lord,**
**Your humble descendant, the aspirant of the Way, [Name] of the Small Dao lineage,**
**desires eternal life and seeks the Dao.**
**Now, contemplating the descending Essence of the Stars,**
**it appears between the two eyebrows,**
**flowing into the nostrils.**
**Swallow it three times five** (三五),
**and visualize the Qi filling the heart, spleen, and liver** (满心胆脾).
**The Dao Mother presides, nourishing the Red Child** (有道母主哺养赤子),
**thus granting eternal life without hunger.** (即不饥长生矣)

The *Eight Substances Scripture* (《八素经》) states:
*"The Supreme Dao declares:*
**The Immortal knows only to refine the flying Elixir** (飞丹),
**to summon the frost** (召霜),
**to distill the clouds and waters** (煎炼云水),
**to forge the freshness of jade and gold** (朱玉鲜金).
**Through nine furnaces of scorching heavens** (九炉炎霄),
**laboring tirelessly in cultivation and sustenance** (勤苦极於营赡),
**and toiling in vigilance** (伺俟足於劬劳),
**those who succeed merely ascend to the heavens** (升身上天),
**or transcend to the Mysterious Isles** (超跃玄洲).
**This is but the way of the Immortal** (仙人而已),
**yet even they may roam the Nine Palaces** (远可游於九宫之间).
**But they have not yet attained the gate to the True Person** (则未有得真人之门户)."

The *Four Extremes Illuminated Science Scripture* (《四极明科经》) states:
**The Golden Elixir Scripture,**
**the Nine Cauldrons Divine Diagram,**
**the Lingya Jade Elixir,**
**the Eight Stones Refined Richness,**
**the Supreme Intelligence Elixir,**
**the Supreme Transformation Elixir Formula,**
**forty-six volumes in total,**
**all containing the Immortal Sovereign’s secret arts** (并仙皇之秘事),
**hidden within the Nine Doubts** (藏於九疑之中),
**transmitted only once every five hundred years.** (五百年一传)

**Elixir Names:**
The *Supreme Dao Scripture of the Most True Science* (《太上太真科经》) states:
**The Immortal’s Nine Elixirs:**
1. **The Elixir of the Natural Dragon Womb of Supreme Harmony** (太和自然龙胎之醴),
2. **The Salve of the Jade Womb and Pure Essence** (玉胎琼液之膏),
3. **The Flying Elixir of Purple Flowers and Descending Essence** (飞丹紫华流精),
4. **The Richness of Vermilion Light and Cloudy Azure** (朱光云碧之腴),
5. **The Divine Elixir of the Nine Abysses and Rainbow Flowers** (九泉虹华神丹),
6. **The Supreme Elixir of the Golden Elixir of Great Purity** (太清金液之华),
7. **The Nine-Refined Frost and Snow Elixir** (九转霜雪之丹),
8. **The Nine Cauldrons Cloud Elixir** (九鼎云英),
9. **The Elixir of Cloud Light** (云光).

**The Water and Stone Elixirs** (水石流飞) **and the Dragon and Tiger Jade Wombs** (龙虎玉胎) **are the Supreme Flying Elixirs.**
**The Vermilion Light and Nine Abysses Elixirs** (朱光九泉) **are of the middle grade,**
**while the Great Purity, Nine Refined, and Nine Cauldrons Cloud Light Elixirs** (太清九转云光) **are of the lower grade.**

The *Nine True Middle Scripture* (《九真中经》) states:
**The Supreme Dao’s Elixir of the Eight Landscapes** (太上八景),
**the Four Petals of Purple Nectar** (四蕊紫浆),
**the Five Pearls of Crimson Morning Elixir** (五珠绛生神丹),
**is also called the Eight Landscapes Elixir** (八景丹),
**or the Four Petals Purple Elixir** (四蕊紫华),
**or the Supreme Micro Purple Jade** (太微紫玉瑛),
**or the Five Pearls Elixir** (五珠华丹),
**or the Crimson Morning Elixir** (绛生晨华),
**or the Triple Elixir Supreme Elixir** (三华上丹),
**or the Supreme Dao’s Flying Rigor** (太上飞刚),
**or the Nine Morning Supreme Elixir** (九晨上丹).
**In total, it bears eight names.** (凡八名也)

The *True Person’s Flowing Pearl Scripture of the Nine Refined Immortal Elixir* (《真人流珠九转神仙九丹经》) states:
**The True Person takes the Nine Elixirs daily** (真人日服九丹),
**granting one the Immortal’s path across lifetimes** (令人神仙度世),
**eternal life and prolonged vision** (长生久视),
**and a lifespan enduring through ten thousand ages.** (长服之寿万世)

**The Nine Elixirs** (九丹) **are the Nine Ways** (九道),
**the Nine Methods** (九方).
**Each requires its own distinct approach** (治之各自有道),
**yet there is a singular method to govern all Nine Elixirs.** (治九丹凡一法也)

**The names of the Nine Elixirs are as follows:**
1. **The Elixir of Flowers** (华丹),
2. **The Elixir of Divine Talismans** (神符丹),
3. **The Divine Elixir** (神丹),
4. **The Return Elixir** (还丹),
5. **The Nourishment Elixir** (饵丹),
6. **The Suitable Elixir** (宜丹),
7. **The Profound Elixir** (深丹),
8. **The Concealed Elixir** (伏丹),
9. **The Cold Elixir** (寒丹).

The *Middle Scripture of the Three Heavenly Lords of the Upper Clarity* (《上清三天君列纪经》) states:
**The Eight Ways of the Central Yellow** (中黄八道),
**the Golden Book with Purple Characters** (金书紫文),
**the Nine-Refined Frost and Snow Lingya Elixir** (九转霜雪琅讦华丹),
**the Return Elixir of White Jade Wine and Golden Elixir** (还白玉酒金液),
**and the Descending Essence of Jade Forests, forming Flowers of the Sun and Moon’s Waters** (流精玉林结华日月之水),
**are all paths of the flying Immortal in broad daylight** (皆白日飞仙登天之道也).
**All are treasures hidden by the White Sovereign Lord** (皆出白帝君所藏於瑶台),
**and without the true records, one cannot attain the method.** (非有真录，不得其法)

The *Great Cavern Jade Scripture’s Annotated Secret Key* (《大洞玉经注诀》) states:
**The Lingya Elixir of Lingering Flowers** (琅讦郁华),
**the Seven Suns of Daylight** (七阳日婴),
**the Nine Pearls’ Elixir** (九琳之液),
**the Eight Pure Essences** (八琼之精),
**the Four Petals of Purple Nectar** (四蕊紫浆),
**the Five Pearls of Crimson Morning Elixir** (五珠绛生),
**the Triple Elixir of Flying Rigor** (三华飞刚),
**the Twin Pearls of Moonlight** (双珠月明),
**the Richness of Orchid and Golden Essence** (兰腴金),
**the Sweet Dew of Jade Vessels** (甘露玉瓶),
**the Weak Silk of Azure Construction** (青建弱罗),
**the Drifting Herb of Flowing Spirit** (漂芝流灵),
**the Divine Elixir Scatter** (神渠丹散),
**the Mysterious Elixir of Intertwined Vines** (玄柯连萦),
**the Lingya Elixir of Morning Formation** (琅玕朝结),
**and the Western Sovereign’s Substantial Fulfillment** (西皇素盈)
**can enable one to soar beyond the Vermilion Heavens** (可以冲跃朱霄),
**to ascend to the Pure Jade Clarity** (飞虚玉清),
**to inhale and exhale as one’s will** (呼而吸之),
**and to reach the Mysterious Spirit** (以至冥灵).
**By rinsing and transforming** (漱而变之),
**one attains the Imperial Court.** (以帝庭)

The *Scripture of the Yellow Qi and Yang Essence’s Three Methods of Harmonious Flow* (《黄气阳精三道顺行经》) states:
**Within the Cavern of Yang, there is the Court of Flowing Fire** (洞阳宫内有流火庭),
**where the eight refined Vermilion Lights** (其中有炎光八炼)
**yield the Natural Mysterious Elixir.** (自然玄丹)

The *Supreme Dao’s Elixir Summary Scripture of the Mystic Ink* (《太上丹简墨灵经》) states:
**To cultivate the way of flying as an Immortal and transcending in ascent** (修飞仙腾超之道),
**one must be granted the method of the thirty-six waters of the Golden Elixir** (当授神丹三十六水金液之术),
**and the Great Purity Elixir Scripture.** (太清丹经)

The *Secret Key of the Lingbao True One’s Natural Way* (《灵宝真一自然经诀》) states:
**The True Dharmakāya Relic** (真舍利) **is the congealed Essence of the Golden Elixir** (是金液之凝精),
**the transformation of the Return Elixir.** (还丹之变化)

The *Inner Transmission of the Supreme Primordial True Person, Master Mao* (《太元真人茅君内传》) states:
**Master Mao bestowed upon his two younger brothers**
**a single dose of the Nine-Refined Return Elixir** (九转还丹一剂),
**and one formula of the Divine Elixir** (并神方一首).
**After bowing and consuming them,**
**the Way of the Immortal was achieved.** (仙道成矣)

**The end of the fourth volume of the Dao Canon’s Discourses.** (道典论卷之四竟)

chunks.original_text: 紫虚三元紫精君#1，形长九千万丈。 春三月，头建九元飞晨缨冠，衣丹锦飞裙，佩九天龙文虎书，带日精育延之剑，足立五色莲华，头圆七宝之光#2。 夏三月，则变形为童子，颓云角髻，衣五色彩衣，手执华旛#3，光明焕烂，照明上清。 秋三月，则变形为龙头蛇躯#4，青黄焕烂，光耀玉虚。 冬三月则变形为紫青白三色之光，沌沌如月之晖。 真阳元老玄一君，形长五千万丈。 夏三月，头建宝晨通精玉冠#5，衣九色云文锦袍，佩太上命神之章龙景丹文，常立紫云之上，坐则七色莲华，光明焕烂#6。 秋三月，则变形为婴儿，坐紫虚之中，头戴五色华盖，手把五芝华幡。 冬三月则变形为月光，青色郁郁，在紫云之中、青华之上，光明流照，洞映上清。 春三月，则变形为青绿玄三色之光，混沌相缠，如云之交，郁勃上清之中。 太微天帝君，形长三千万丈。 秋三月，头建九元飞缨冠#7，衣七色凤云之袍，带夜光宝章交灵素绶#8，常立五色师子上，身生三十二色宝光，在上清之上。 冬三月，则变形为无量真仙#9，身负金光，照明十方，立九色之华上，手执金铃。 春三月，则化形为日光，紫芒焕烂，在玉虚之上，照明十方。 夏三月，则变形为白苍绿三色之光，更相缠绕，如蕾买之沓。 青灵阳安君，形长五千万丈。 冬三月，头建三精芙蓉晨冠，衣云文丹锦飞裘，足履九色师子，佩流金火铃，交带七元，身生七变之光，炜晔玉清之上。 春三月，则变形为老公，头戴飞龙，口衔月身，衣羽衣，手持紫绶，在丹霞之上，昭明玉清。 夏三月，则变形为虎头人身，五色斑斓，光照十方。 秋三月，则变形为黄绿紫三色之光，混沌上 清，如日之晕。 上元太素三元君，形长三千万丈#10。 春三月，头建宝玄扶晨羽冠#11服紫炁浮云锦帔、九色龙锦羽裙，腰带流金火铃虎符龙书#12，坐於太虚之中#13，膝下常有丹绿青三色之云，光明炜晔，照玄十方。 夏三月，则变形为一躯三头，戴七称宝冠，身服三素飞云锦衣，立九色凤凰之上，照明十方。 秋三月，则变形为七曜，华精玉光，炜哗紫云之上#14光色郁郁，如日之晖。 冬三月，则变身为青紫白三色之光，蓊蓊勃勃，如金之精。 高上太素君，形长三千万丈。 夏三月，头建紫元宝冠，衣丹锦七色之襡，佩豁落七曜元章，带三宝招仙之策、常立五色莲华上，光明焕照。 秋三月，变形为龙头人身，五色斑斓，光明流曜，映照十方。 冬三月，则变形为三目之神#15，光色沌沌，照明上清。 春三月，则变形为苍白二色之光#16，奕奕在元炁之中，紫霄之上。 上清紫精三素君，形长七千万丈。 秋三月，头建通精晨冠，衣五色斑文虎衣，佩交灵素绶，带招仙之剑，常立九色师子之上#17，项生圆光，照明上清。 冬三月，变形为凤头人身，衣苍碧紫三色羽衣，光明流焕上清之中。 春三月，则变形为人头龙身，文彩焕曜，照明上清。 夏三月，则变形为黑黄二色之光，混沌相缠，如云之升。 皇清洞真君，形长五千万丈。 冬三月，头建三梁玉晨之冠，衣七色虎文之裘#18带流金火铃七色杖旛，常立三素飞云之上，光明炜灿玉虚之内。 春三月则变形，头建黄巾，衣三十二条法衣，手执华旛，在紫云之上。

The Purple Void Three Primordials Purple Essence Lord,¹ whose form spans ninety million *zhang*. In the three months of spring, his head bears the Nine Primordials Flying Dawn Tassel Crown, he wears a cinnabar brocade flying skirt, and is girded with the Nine Heavens Dragon-Script Tiger Talisman. At his waist hangs the Sun Essence Life-Extending Sword, and his feet stand upon a five-colored lotus. His head radiates the light of the Seven Treasures.² In the three months of summer, he transforms into a youth with cloud-tousled topknots, clad in five-colored robes, holding a flowered banner. His radiance blazes brilliantly, illuminating the Highest Clarity. In the three months of autumn, he transforms into a dragon-headed, serpent-bodied form, azure and yellow resplendent, his light illuminating the Jade Void. In the three months of winter, he transforms into a tri-colored light of purple, azure, and white, dim and luminous like the moon’s glow.

The True Yang Primordial Elder Mysterious Unity Lord, whose form spans fifty million *zhang*. In the three months of summer, his head bears the Treasure Dawn Permeating Essence Jade Crown,⁵ he wears a nine-colored cloud-patterned brocade robe, and is girded with the Supreme Lord’s Mandate Spirit Seal and Dragon Radiance Cinnabar Script. He constantly stands upon purple clouds, and when seated, rests upon a seven-colored lotus. His radiance blazes brilliantly.⁶ In the three months of autumn, he transforms into an infant seated within the Purple Void, his head crowned with a five-colored flowered canopy, holding a five-fungus flowered banner. In the three months of winter, he transforms into moonlight, azure and luxuriant, within the purple clouds and above the azure blossoms. His radiance flows and illuminates, penetrating the Highest Clarity. In the three months of spring, he transforms into a tri-colored light of azure, green, and dark, interwoven in chaos like intertwining clouds, surging within the Highest Clarity.

The Supreme Micro Heavenly Emperor Lord, whose form spans thirty million *zhang*. In the three months of autumn, his head bears the Nine Primordials Flying Tassel Crown,⁷ he wears a seven-colored phoenix-cloud robe, and is girded with the Night Radiance Treasure Seal and Intertwining Spirit Silk Sash.⁸ He constantly stands upon a five-colored lion, his body emanating thirty-two hues of precious light, above the Highest Clarity. In the three months of winter, he transforms into boundless Perfected Immortals,⁹ his body suffused with golden light, illuminating the ten directions. He stands upon a nine-colored blossom, holding a golden bell. In the three months of spring, he transforms into sunlight, purple rays blazing brilliantly above the Jade Void, illuminating the ten directions. In the three months of summer, he transforms into a tri-colored light of white, azure, and green, intertwining like layered petals.

The Azure Spirit Yang Peace Lord, whose form spans fifty million *zhang*. In the three months of winter, his head bears the Three Essences Hibiscus Dawn Crown, he wears a cloud-patterned cinnabar brocade flying robe, and his feet tread upon a nine-colored lion. He is girded with flowing gold fire bells and the Seven Primordials sash. His body emanates sevenfold-transforming light, resplendent above the Jade Clarity. In the three months of spring, he transforms into an elder with a flying dragon upon his head, his mouth holding the moon, clad in feathered robes, and holding a purple sash. He stands upon cinnabar clouds, illuminating the Jade Clarity. In the three months of summer, he transforms into a tiger-headed, human-bodied form, five-colored and variegated, his light illuminating the ten directions. In the three months of autumn, he transforms into a tri-colored light of yellow, green, and purple, chaotic within the Highest Clarity, like the sun’s halo.

The Highest Primordial Supreme Three Primordials Lord, whose form spans thirty million *zhang*.¹⁰ In the three months of spring, his head bears the Treasure Mystery Supporting Dawn Feather Crown,¹¹ he wears a purple *qi* floating cloud brocade cloak and a nine-colored dragon brocade feathered skirt. At his waist hang flowing gold fire bells, tiger talismans, and dragon scripts.¹² He sits within the Great Void,¹³ beneath his knees ever-present clouds of cinnabar, green, and azure, their radiance blazing brilliantly, illuminating the ten directions of the Mysterious. In the three months of summer, he transforms into a single body with three heads, wearing a seven-tiered treasure crown and clad in a three-pure flying cloud brocade robe. He stands upon a nine-colored phoenix, illuminating the ten directions. In the three months of autumn, he transforms into the Seven Luminaries, their flowery essence and jade light blazing upon purple clouds,¹⁴ their luminous hues luxuriant like the sun’s glow. In the three months of winter, he transforms into a tri-colored light of azure, purple, and white, dense and surging like golden essence.

The Highest Supreme Primordial Lord, whose form spans thirty million *zhang*. In the three months of summer, his head bears the Purple Primordial Treasure Crown, he wears a cinnabar brocade seven-colored robe, and is girded with the Vast Falling Seven Luminaries Primordial Seal. At his waist hangs the Three Treasures Summoning Immortals’ Staff. He constantly stands upon a five-colored lotus, his radiance blazing brilliantly. In the three months of autumn, he transforms into a dragon-headed, human-bodied form, five-colored and variegated, his radiance flowing and illuminating the ten directions. In the three months of winter, he transforms into a three-eyed spirit,¹⁵ his light dim and luminous, illuminating the Highest Clarity. In the three months of spring, he transforms into a dual-colored light of azure and white,¹⁶ resplendent within the Primordial *Qi*, above the Purple Empyrean.

The Highest Clarity Purple Essence Three Purities Lord, whose form spans seventy million *zhang*. In the three months of autumn, his head bears the Permeating Essence Dawn Crown, he wears a five-colored variegated tiger robe, and is girded with the Intertwining Spirit Silk Sash and the Summoning Immortals’ Sword. He constantly stands upon a nine-colored lion,¹⁷ his neck emanating a halo of light illuminating the Highest Clarity. In the three months of winter, he transforms into a phoenix-headed, human-bodied form, clad in azure, green, and purple feathered robes, his radiance flowing and blazing within the Highest Clarity. In the three months of spring, he transforms into a human-headed, dragon-bodied form, his patterns resplendent and illuminating the Highest Clarity. In the three months of summer, he transforms into a dual-colored light of black and yellow, chaotic and intertwining like ascending clouds.

The August Clarity Cavern Perfected Lord, whose form spans fifty million *zhang*. In the three months of winter, his head bears the Three-Ridge Jade Dawn Crown, he wears a seven-colored tiger-patterned robe,¹⁸ and is girded with flowing gold fire bells and a seven-colored staff banner. He constantly stands upon three-pure flying clouds, his radiance blazing resplendently within the Jade Void. In the three months of spring, he transforms, his head bearing a yellow kerchief, clad in a thirty-two-striped ritual robe, holding a flowered banner, standing upon purple clouds.

chunks.original_text: 夏三月，则变形，冥目内视，头戴华盖，足立莲华。 秋三月，则变形为黄白二色之光，明流焕曜#19在太空之中，照明十天。 皇上四老道君#20形长七千万丈。 春三月，头建元真七宝玉冠，衣凤文斑裘，佩豁落流铃，带招真之策，常立九色师子，十二华光，在上清之上。 夏三月，则变形为小儿，衣五彩之衣，口衔七星，立白云之上。 秋三月，则变形为人头蛇身，五色斑斓在玉虚之上。 冬三月，则变形为青赤白三色之云，更相缠绕，在玄虚之中#21。 玉晨太上大道君，形长九千万丈。 秋三月，头建百变神光玉冠，披飞森霜珠之袍、七色虎衣，佩九色离罗之章，带晨光月明之铃，常坐七色之云，光明流曜上清之中。 冬三月，则变形，头戴七光圆轮#22，身着三十二色法衣#23,足立九色师子之上，光明炜烨，在上清之上、太微之中。 春三月，则变形为老子，头建角巾，身着虎文之衣，手执金符，在五芝华上。 夏三月，变形为紫黄二色#24，光明奕奕，更相缠绕，在紫虚之中。 中央黄老君，形长三千万丈。 夏三月，头建宝琅晨冠，衣九色云文裘，带交灵紫绶，十二华光，常立五色师子之上，光明流曜上清之中。 秋三月，则变形为玉童，头戴七精之华冠，衣飞天羽衣，手执华旛。 冬三月，则变形为真仙#25，通身黄金之色，衣七色衣，项负圆轮#26，足履莲华之上，光明流焕。 春三月，则变形为紫绿青三色之光，更相缠绕，在玉虚之上。 太极大道无景君，形长三千万丈。 秋三月，头建晨缨宝冠，衣无缝九色章衣，佩神虎上符，带宝仙之剑，项负流金之光，昭明七十四方，常立玄龟之上。 冬三月，则变形为虎头龙身，五色文彩，明彻上清。 春三月，则变形为老子，散发至腰，衣飞青羽衣，立紫云之上。 夏三月，则变形为赤青二色之光，更相缠绕，在紫虚之上。 太清大道君，形长九千万丈。 冬三月，头建九元通天之冠，衣九色龙衣，佩三炁中章，带交灵素绶，足立三素之云，光明焕曜，在上清之上。 春三月，则变形为三头之凤，口衔素绶，一身有九色之羽，文彩焕烂，洞映上清。 夏三月，则变形为三色之圆光，色赤纯纯，如车之轮，光明洞曜，在太清之上。 秋三月，则变形为紫白黄三色之光，光明焕烂，洞昭上清。 皇初紫元君，形长九千万丈。 春三月，头建紫元宝琅神冠，衣三色虎文之裘，佩素灵之绶，足立三素之云，光明映照，洞观十方，在上清之上、八微之内。 夏三月，则变形为真仙，通身金色，项负圆轮，文彩焕烂，光明奕奕，照映十方。 秋三月，则变形为三色童子，衣五彩之衣，手把华旛，奕奕焕烂，照明上清。 冬三月，则变形为苍碧紫三色之光，光明焕照，映朗上清。 无英中真上老君，形长七千万丈。 夏三月，头建通天宝冠，衣七色斑文之衣，佩灵飞紫绶，带通真之剑，立九色师子之上，光明洞照，焕赫上清。 秋三月，则变身为老公，头戴黄巾，衣黄缁之袍，手把金杖，立莲花之上，光明照映十方。 冬三月，则变形为三日之光，光明奕奕，照映十天，三炁混合，如鸡子之黄。 春三月，则变身为紫苍白三色之光，光明焕照，映彻九天。 《九真中经》云：中央黄老君者，太上太微天帝君之弟子也。

chunks.original_text: 以清虚上皇二年混尔始生，日晖重曜，连光映灵，五云翳盖，庆烟玄停。 年七岁焉，仍自长生之要，天仙之法，乃眇纶上思，钦纳玄真，萧条灵想，心栖神源，广体八绝，握空投金，解脱於文蔚之罗，披素於空任之肆，目豁玄元之户，手披万寝之庭，尔乃天韵妙蔼，宿会玄感。 於是太上以帝君九真之经、八道秘言之章，施修道成，受书为太极真人。 《紫书金根经》云：青要帝君者，九阳元皇玉帝弟子。 以中皇元年岁在东维天始告晖君，育於玄丘玉国无崖之天琼琳七宝之下，溟蒙九域之滨，法化应图，三旦启晨，仍有九龙翼君侧，七色琼凤荫君身，神麟合芝以玄明，天女吐精以灌真，玉童掷华以却秽，神妃散香以攘尘。 含漱胎息，法秀自然，年冠二六，面发金容，体生灵符，言钧金章，七十二色，洞映玉形，三晨缠络，六炁齐轮，玄灵紫盖，生乎房飞精流光照其庭含真独秀熙颐灵吗容序顺化，随运沉浮，栖心明霞之境，遨浪玉国之墟，执抗元皇之策，落景九域之丘，逍遥流眄。 遂经累劫，方还清斋云房之间，以紫云为屋，青霞为城，黄金为殿，白玉为床，五炁交结，台高连层，玉陛文阶，凤阙四张，金童侍侧，玉华执巾，天仙罗卫五千余人，备天之兽#27，羽骑如鳞，龙虎辟邪，偶偶双蹲，玄炁九会，灵风扬烟，芳香激无虚生琼宫，流精玉光，洞映八天#28。 青要是紫清帝君之别号，受元皇玉帝紫书妙诀，皆众经之要秘，九天之上书，八会之隐文也。 玉帝命高上直真总仙君断集宝目，合为众誉经，以紫笔缮文，金简为篇，皆出上皇玄古之道，高圣所撰，集以成卷，传於青要帝君。 《紫度炎光经》云：太微天帝君，生乎始青之端，元曜灵之胤，玄炁未凝之始，结流芳之冑法形焉，连光映灵，紫云曜电，玄烟掩蔼，丹晖缠络，妙觉潜启，仍采纳上契，条畅纯和，吐纳冥津，遂降虚生之胎，哺兼洪泉曲芝#29，结形之始，仍学招真之道，遐思远览，潜想内瞻，坐观无崖，洞存幽虚。 年始三岁焉，中方审正，真神披朗，逆知未然，究览极天之境，无幽不鉴，无上不睹，无下不窥也#30。 年行二七，金容内发，玉华外映，洞慧神聪#31，朗睹虚玄，偏堂帝号#32，其任乎澄流九霄之霞，飞眺洞清之源，明机览於极玄，领综运乎亿津，积感加于冥会，妙感发於自然，遂受太帝之号，积感所降，岂生便任乎？ 《三华宝曜内员上经》云#33：南极总司定录上真禁君，以始皇元年岁在壬午七月七日中时#34，於上上禅善无量 寿天玉国七宝洞虚凤京紫台琼琳之下#35，稽首玉轩，请问玉帝虚皇天尊，天胤皇基，名题帝篇，位登上司，总监万仙，而未获启授度命之方，愿赐宝诀，以度后贤。 於是，虚皇道君告南极总司上真禁君曰：金房度命回年之诀，秘在九天之上、大有之宫、金台玉室九曲之房，此道玄微，非中真所参得行此法，与九炁同根，齐光三景，天地长存，修之万遍，位加仙卿，乘烟驾虚，上造帝皇，今以相告，顺而行焉。 《高上元始玉皇谱录经》具出八百道君，名讳，今所不录也。 大神 《太上太真科经》云：太空太虚，太元，无始无初，有一大神体无而有，有智有灵，灵智慧解，洞照群生，群生有感，太神降应，应为感主，号曰太神。

In the second year of the Qingxu Shanghuang era, amidst primordial chaos, he first came into being. The sun’s radiance doubled in splendor, its light interwoven with the numinous. Five-colored clouds formed a canopy, while auspicious mist and mysterious haze settled in stillness.

At the age of seven, he naturally grasped the essentials of longevity and the methods of celestial transcendence. With profound contemplation, he reverently embraced the mysterious and true, his spirit wandering in solitude, his heart dwelling in the wellspring of the divine. He widely embodied the eight absolutes, grasped emptiness and cast forth gold, freed himself from the nets of ornate entanglement, and roamed unbound through the marketplace of the void. His eyes opened the gate of the mysterious origin, his hands parted the halls of the myriad chambers. Thus, the celestial melody exquisitely resounded, and karmic resonance with the mysterious arose.

Thereupon, the Supreme August One bestowed upon him the *Scripture of the Nine Perfected* of the Emperor Lord and the secret chapters of the Eight Dao. Through cultivation, he achieved the Dao and received the scriptures, becoming the Perfected of the Great Ultimate.

The *Scripture of the Golden Root in Purple Script* states: The Azure Essence Emperor Lord is a disciple of the Nine Yang Primordial Jade Emperor. In the first year of the Zhonghuang era, in the year corresponding to the Eastern Pivot of Heaven, he first announced his radiance to the Lord of Light and was nurtured in the Jasper Forest of the Seven Treasures beneath the boundless Heaven of the Jade Mound in the Jade Land of the Mystic Mound. At the edge of the ninefold domains, his dharma-transformations aligned with the celestial patterns. For three dawns, the morning light broke forth. Nine dragons flanked his side, while seven-colored jasper phoenixes shaded his body. Divine unicorns and sacred mushrooms emitted mysterious radiance, celestial maidens exhaled essence to nourish his perfection, jade lads cast flowers to dispel impurity, and divine consorts scattered incense to repel dust.

He practiced fetal breathing and natural refinement. At the age of twelve, his face shone with a golden countenance, his body bore sacred talismans, his words chimed like golden ornaments, and seventy-two hues luminously reflected his jade form. For three mornings, the celestial net enveloped him; the six *qi* turned in unison. A mysterious canopy of purple spirit arose from his chamber, and the flowing essence of light illuminated his courtyard. Alone, he embodied the perfected and flourished, his spirit harmonious and his demeanor orderly, following the transformations of the cosmos, rising and sinking with its currents. His heart dwelled in the realm of luminous rosy clouds, and he roamed the jade precincts of the Jade Land. Wielding the staff of the Primordial August One, he traversed the ninefold domains and the mounds of the setting sun, carefree and gazing afar.

After countless kalpas, he returned to the cloud chambers of the pure retreat. There, purple clouds formed his dwelling, rosy clouds his city, yellow gold his palace, and white jade his couch. The five *qi* intertwined, his terrace rose in layered heights, jade steps adorned with patterns, phoenix towers facing the four directions. Golden lads attended his side, jade maidens held his towels. Over five thousand celestial transcendents arrayed as guards, celestial beasts in formation, feathered riders like scales, dragons and tigers warding off evil, paired and crouching in symmetry. The ninefold convergence of mysterious *qi*, the divine wind stirring the mist, fragrant incense wafting ceaselessly through the jasper palace, flowing essence and jade light penetratingly illuminating the Eight Heavens.

Azure Essence is an alternate name of the Purple Clarity Emperor Lord. He received the Purple Script’s wondrous formulas from the Primordial Jade Emperor—all essential secrets of the myriad scriptures, celestial writings of the Nine Heavens, and hidden texts of the Eight Assemblies.

The Jade Emperor commanded the Highest Direct Perfected, the General Lord of Transcendents, to compile and edit the precious catalog, gathering them into the *Scripture of Collective Praise*. With purple brush, he transcribed the texts, inscribing them on golden tablets—all derived from the Way of the Primordial Sovereign of Antiquity, composed by the loftiest sages, compiled into scrolls, and transmitted to the Azure Essence Emperor Lord.

The *Scripture of Purple Radiance and Blazing Light* states: The Emperor Lord of the Supreme Tenuity Heaven was born at the inception of the Primordial Azure, an heir of the numinous radiance. At the very beginning when the mysterious *qi* had yet to coalesce, he took form as the lineage of flowing fragrance. His light interwove with the numinous, purple clouds blazed like lightning, mysterious mist enveloped the sky, and cinnabar radiance entwined him. Subtle awakening arose in concealment. He gathered and embraced the supreme harmony, unfolding the pure and harmonious. Exhaling and inhaling the dark abyss, he descended into the womb of emptiness and birth, nourished by the curved mushrooms of the vast spring. At the inception of his form, he studied the Way of summoning the perfected. With distant thoughts and far-reaching vision, he inwardly contemplated, sitting in observation of the boundless, profoundly preserving the hidden and void.

At the age of three, he rectified the center and aligned with correctness. His true spirit became luminous, and he foresaw what had not yet come to pass. He thoroughly examined the farthest reaches of the celestial realms—no hidden place was not discerned, no height was not seen, no depth was not peered into.

At the age of fourteen, his golden countenance inwardly shone, and jade splendor outwardly reflected. His wisdom was penetrating, his spirit keen. He bore the title of Emperor of the Lateral Hall, his duty to purify the rosy clouds of the Nine Empyreans and gaze afar upon the source of the Clarity of the Void. He illuminated the mechanisms of the utmost mystery, governed and synthesized the currents of the myriad streams. Accumulated resonance added to the hidden convergence, and wondrous resonance arose naturally. Thus, he received the title of Supreme Emperor, the accumulation of resonance bestowed upon him—not merely granted by birth.

The *Scripture of the Three Flowers’ Precious Radiance and Inner Circle* states: The Southern Culmen, General Controller of the Registers, Supreme Perfected Lord of Prohibitions, in the first year of the Shihuang era, the year corresponding to *renwu*, on the seventh day of the seventh month at midday, in the Jasper Forest beneath the Seven Treasures of the Boundless Longevity Heaven’s Jade Land, the Phoenix Capital’s Purple Terrace, bowed his head at the Jade Pavilion and inquired of the Jade Emperor, the Heavenly Worthy of the Primordial Void: Though the celestial heir and imperial foundation have had their names inscribed in the imperial records and have ascended to the highest office, overseeing the myriad transcendents, they have yet to receive the methods of bestowing the mandate of salvation. I wish to be granted the precious formulas to save later worthies.

Thereupon, the Heavenly Worthy of the Primordial Void addressed the Southern Culmen, General Controller, Supreme Perfected Lord of Prohibitions: The formulas for extending life and reversing years in the Golden Chamber are secretly preserved in the Nine Heavens above, in the Palace of Great Existence, the Ninefold Chamber of the Golden Terrace and Jade Hall. This Way is profoundly subtle; it is not something that median perfected ones can participate in or practice. This method shares the same root as the nine *qi* and equals the radiance of the Three Luminaries. Heaven and Earth endure forever. If cultivated ten thousand times, one’s rank will be elevated to that of an immortal minister. Riding the mist and driving the void, one will ascend to the imperial throne. I now reveal this to you—follow and practice it.

The *Scripture of the Jade Emperor’s Genealogy of the Primordial August One* fully lists the eight hundred Dao Lords by name and title, which are not recorded here.

The Great Spirit:
The *Canon of the Supreme Perfected* of the Supreme August One states: The Great Void, the Great Primordial—without beginning, without origin—contains a Great Spirit, formless yet existent, possessing wisdom and numinosity. His numinous wisdom and understanding penetratingly illuminate all beings. When beings have resonance, the Great Spirit descends in response, responding as the master of resonance. He is called the Great Spirit.

chunks.original_text: 《老君经诫》云：神人者，体道洞灵，变化应因，无形而形，乍亡乍存，散则为炁，聚即为人，往来无门，出入无 间，升天降地，经营六合之中，有道之所则为人征，不行自至，不呼而应，施玄功阴泽深化阴，名不可名，故谓神人。 《太上灵宝无量度人上品妙经》云：中有度人不死之神，中有度世司马大神，中有南上度厄尊神，长生度世无量大神。 飞天 《明真科经》云：天尊於是命召十方飞天神人，披长夜之府，九幽玉匮，出明真科律，以度童子。 《太上灵宝无量度人上品妙经》云：今日校录诸天临轩，今释今日者，总指三元八节斋直之晨，则十方飞天、一切大圣同会玉京，校定录籍，天尊尔日大庆临轩。 东方无极飞天神王长生大圣，无量度人。 南方无极飞天神王长生大圣，无量度人。 西方无极飞天神王长生大圣，无量度人。 北方无极飞天神王长生大圣，无量度人。 东北无极飞天神王长生大圣，无量度人。 东南无极飞天神王长生大圣，无量度人。 西南无极飞天神王长生大圣，无量度人。 西北无极飞天神王长生大圣，无量度人。 上方无极飞 天神王长生大圣，无量度人。 下方无极飞天神王长生大圣，无量度人。 十方至真飞天神王长生度世无量，大神并乘飞云，丹舆绿辇，亿乘万骑，浮空而来。 童子 《灵宝五炼生尸经》云：天尊时於长乐舍香林园中，教化七千二百四十童子，法事粗悉，上智童子上白天尊：今既开宥，一切普新，皇道既畅，泽被十方，伏愿天尊既垂大慈，愿卒皇恩。 於是天尊普命诸天上帝，今当更为上智童子开诸法门。 《紫度炎光经》云：东方青光童子，名青上玉，字飞正，身作碧霞之色，流光焕照。 南方赤光童子，名丹晖，字玄纪，身作赤霞之色，流光镜於南方。 西方白光童子，名浩华，字回神子，身作素霞之色，流光焕照。 北方黑光童子，名玄明上，字太阴文，身作皂霞之色，流光洞照，焕於北方。 中央黄光童子，名执忠，字黄录子，身作黄霞之色，如黄金之精，流光焕烂。 《太上智慧经》赞曰： 金华擎洞经，捧香悉仙童，啸歌彻玄都，鸣玉叩瑶锺。 《升玄经》云：金光童子。 现人才服饰品板目。 《上清三天君列纪经》云：少野童子。 现地才山品上目也。 《大洞真经》云：始元童子。 现地山品洞目。 大士 《升玄经》云：太上曰：道陵，汝可与此大士共相劳问。 是大士者，名曰善胜。 此大士久修净行，功业成就，与汝无异。 《太上太真科经》云：小乘与学险魔恼破之被不度长属六天，是以大士发心上乘功高德重魔不能坏，虽来干触，皆即归降。 归降受事，转身为真，不能顿转，犹为魔群保举，学士辅护升玄也。 《太上太霄琅书经》云：大士大乘，济度无量。 研寻至道，洞智慧源，始终无违，身足救物，克得神仙，与宝合矣。 道典论卷之一竟 #1虚：敦煌本作『灵』。 另，此句前敦煌本有文曰：『（前缺）月，头建天元七宝冠，衣九色珠缝云光锦裙，佩六山火玉，带灵飞紫绶，常立五色师子莲花之上，焕明上清七十四方。 秋三月则变形，人头虎躯，玄黄班文，文彩之云光照千方。 尽三月则变形，通身金光，头负华盖，衣卅二色法衣，如佛之像，光明弈弈，照明上清。

The *Scripture of Laozi’s Admonitions* states: The divine person embodies the Dao and penetrates the numinous, transforming and responding to causes. Without form yet taking form, now vanishing, now abiding—dispersed, they become qi; gathered, they become human. They come and go without gate, enter and exit without gap, ascending to heaven and descending to earth, operating within the Six Directions. Where the Dao resides, they manifest as human omens; without being summoned, they arrive; without being called, they respond. They bestow mysterious merit and profound transformations in secret, their name beyond naming—thus they are called the divine person.

The *Supreme Wondrous Scripture of the Numinous Treasure’s Limitless Salvation of Humanity* states: Within it is the divine being who saves people from death; within it is the Controller of Horses, the great divine being who saves the world; within it is the Venerable Divine Being of the Southern Heights who saves from calamity; the boundless great divine beings who grant immortality and save the world.

**Flying Immortals**
The *Scripture of Illuminating Perfection* states: The Heavenly Worthy then commanded the summoning of the flying immortals and divine persons of the ten directions. They opened the repository of the Long Night, the Nine Dark Jade Caskets, and brought forth the *Illuminating Perfection’s Codes and Precepts* to save the youths.

The *Supreme Wondrous Scripture of the Numinous Treasure’s Limitless Salvation of Humanity* states: Today, the records of all heavens are examined beneath the imperial canopy. "Today" here collectively refers to the mornings of the Three Origins and Eight Festivals’ fasting vigils, when the flying immortals of the ten directions and all great sages assemble at Jade Capital to review and determine the registers. On that day, the Heavenly Worthy celebrates with a grand audience beneath the canopy.

The **Eastern Limitless Flying Immortal Divine King, Great Sage of Eternal Life**, boundlessly saves humanity.
The **Southern Limitless Flying Immortal Divine King, Great Sage of Eternal Life**, boundlessly saves humanity.
The **Western Limitless Flying Immortal Divine King, Great Sage of Eternal Life**, boundlessly saves humanity.
The **Northern Limitless Flying Immortal Divine King, Great Sage of Eternal Life**, boundlessly saves humanity.
The **Northeastern Limitless Flying Immortal Divine King, Great Sage of Eternal Life**, boundlessly saves humanity.
The **Southeastern Limitless Flying Immortal Divine King, Great Sage of Eternal Life**, boundlessly saves humanity.
The **Southwestern Limitless Flying Immortal Divine King, Great Sage of Eternal Life**, boundlessly saves humanity.
The **Northwestern Limitless Flying Immortal Divine King, Great Sage of Eternal Life**, boundlessly saves humanity.
The **Upper Limitless Flying Immortal Divine King, Great Sage of Eternal Life**, boundlessly saves humanity.
The **Lower Limitless Flying Immortal Divine King, Great Sage of Eternal Life**, boundlessly saves humanity.
The **Perfected Flying Immortal Divine Kings of the Ten Directions, Great Sages of Eternal Life who boundlessly save the world**, all ride flying clouds, crimson chariots, and green carriages, with a hundred million chariots and ten thousand riders, arriving through the void.

**Youths**
The *Scripture of the Five Refinements of the Numinous Treasure to Revive the Corpse* states: At that time, the Heavenly Worthy was in the Fragrant Grove Garden of the Abode of Eternal Joy, teaching and transforming seven thousand two hundred and forty youths. When the Dharma matters were roughly complete, the most wise youths addressed the Heavenly Worthy: "Now that all has been opened and renewed, the August Dao flows freely, and its blessings extend to the ten directions. We humbly beseech the Heavenly Worthy to continue bestowing great compassion and fulfill the August Grace."

Thereupon, the Heavenly Worthy universally commanded the Celestial Emperors of all heavens to open the Dharma gates anew for the most wise youths.

The *Scripture of the Purple Radiance of Blazing Light* states:
The **Eastern Azure Radiance Youth**, named Azure Supreme Jade, styled Flying Upright, his body the color of blue-green mist, his flowing light shining brilliantly.
The **Southern Crimson Radiance Youth**, named Cinnabar Splendor, styled Mysterious Record, his body the color of red mist, his flowing light mirroring the southern direction.
The **Western White Radiance Youth**, named Vast Splendor, styled Returning Spirit Child, his body the color of white mist, his flowing light shining brilliantly.
The **Northern Black Radiance Youth**, named Mysterious Brightness Supreme, styled Supreme Yin Script, his body the color of black mist, his flowing light penetratingly illuminating the northern direction.
The **Central Yellow Radiance Youth**, named Upholding Loyalty, styled Yellow Register Child, his body the color of yellow mist, like the essence of yellow gold, his flowing light resplendent.

The *Scripture of Supreme Wisdom* praises:
Golden flowers hold the *Cavern Scripture*,
Fragrant incense is borne by all immortal youths.
Their whistling songs resound through the Mysterious Capital,
Jade chimes strike the jasper bells.

The *Scripture of Ascending to the Mystery* states: The **Golden Radiance Youth**.

*(Descriptions of attire and appearance follow.)*

The *Scripture of the Arrayed Records of the Three Heavenly Lords of Highest Clarity* states: The **Lesser Wild Youth**.

*(Descriptions of terrestrial and mountain ranks follow.)*

The *Perfect Scripture of the Great Cavern* states: The **Primordial Origin Youth**.

*(Descriptions of terrestrial, mountain, and cavern ranks follow.)*

**Great Beings**
The *Scripture of Ascending to the Mystery* states: The Most High said: "Dao-ling, you may exchange greetings with this Great Being." This Great Being is named Excellent Victory. Having long cultivated pure practices, his merits and accomplishments are complete, no different from yours.

The *Scripture of the Supreme Perfected’s Codes* states: Those of the Lesser Vehicle who study perilous demonic disturbances are not saved but remain bound to the Six Heavens. Thus, the Great Being arouses the mind toward the Supreme Vehicle, where merits are lofty and virtue weighty, and demons cannot corrupt. Though they come to harass, all immediately submit and surrender. Having surrendered and received their duties, they transform their bodies into the real. If they cannot transform instantly, they remain among the demonic hosts, who recommend and protect them, assisting the students to ascend to the Mystery.

The *Scripture of the Supreme Numinous Writ of the Jade Pivot* states: The Great Being of the Supreme Vehicle boundlessly saves and delivers. Delving into the ultimate Dao, penetrating the source of wisdom, unwavering from beginning to end, their person suffices to save beings. They attain transcendence and unite with the treasure.

The first fascicle of the *Discourses on Daoist Canons* concludes.

He constantly stands upon a five-colored lion lotus, resplendent in the seventy-four directions of Highest Clarity. chunks.original_text: 《太上太真科经》云：凡开辟之初，圣真仙人皆宣道炁，立法相，传同宗，太上俱称学士，以道为事，故曰道事。 道事有功，故号道士。 道士者，以道为事，圣运升度。 众魔又兴，皆由人物情浅所致，邪虽伐正，真去邪来，来同邪人，不干正士。 正士事道，学法依科，魔王敬护，邪精敢侵？ 所以受道之身，皆是天魔上官，天魔众神皆是道士下官。 《升玄经》云：夫唯贤者与彼俗人事事有反，目不多瞻，见好不惊，耳不听谗，不听乱声，鼻不受香，芬芳之腥，口不尝甘，茹犯众生，心不想欲财色、华荣，手不奸用，足不恶行。 此是道士之行者也。 《本愿大戒经》云：有道之士取诸我身，无求乎人。 道言：修之身，其德乃真。 斯之谓也。 《洞渊经》云：道士贵人，悉天上来生也。 自非先身之积善者，终不得作道士矣。 《正一真人演千明科经》云：清德道士已经三乘，教化一切，施行众善，触事得法，可进供养三洞尊经。 《太上太霄琅书经》云：明解须专，专必有应，应则通神，何劳乎感？ 欣戚两遣日夜专勤，誓进无退，号为道人。 人行大道，号为道士。 士者何也？ 理也，事也。 身心顺理，唯道是从，从道为事，故称道士。 先生 《敷斋威仪经》云：真人曰：学士若能弃世累，有远游山水之志，宗极法轮，称先生常坐高座读经，教化愚贤，开度一切学人也。 若复清真至德，能通玄妙义者，随行弟子同学为称某先生，其人钩深致远，才学玄洞，志在大乘，当称玄静先生，或游玄先生，或远游先生，或宣道先生，或畅玄先生。 略言其比，不可胜载，须世有其人学者，称夫先生道士也。 《升玄经》云：仙公又向太极真人长跪言：归诚先生，愿降法泽，滋润枯槁，使将来道士得修至真，弃邪法术。 《三元布经》云：太上太道君受此经於玄古先生，以传玄都仙王。 《上清变化七十四方经》云：紫府先生能为不死，恬和天真，洞思守神，年三千岁，故未升天，盘桓洞室，采择上真。 《元始变化龟山元录经》云：皇上万始先生，形九千万文。 冬三月，头建丹阳日精之冠，衣赤云明光锦袍，佩金虎凤文，带丹皇紫章，常乘白云，坐五色师子，光明流曜，焕照上清。 春三月，则变形为人躯三头凤皇，衣九色斑文虎衣，常立十二华光之上。 夏三月，则变形为三日之晖，紫光八芒，烂映焕明，在上清之上，十二色莲华之中。 秋三月，则化形为青赤紫三色之光，更相缠绕，如日之轮。 《上清紫晨经》云：上皇先生紫晨君，盖二晖之胤结玉晨之精育龙烟于太空，包紫虚以通灵，托九玄以含秀，凝洪露以成神。 陶三炁以自观，经玄母以法生，任历劫而受化，感日吉而曜形，於是上皇元年天甲启晨诞於神州八朗之天，平丘中域，洞渊之滨。 既生之且面发金容，体映玉光，五色紫章，七十二变，精玉颜，神龙吐芝以濯溉，鸾凤抚翼以阴玄，丹霄散景於琼轩，流光焕烂於霞真，二景停晖於八玄，七元回精以匡晨，金仙散香以乱炁，神妃掷华以发烟，五纬结落神秀紫天，年冠二九，逍遥中元，餐精咽炁，吐纳灵津，含芝内灌，凝神胎仙，挹漱守默，淡泊自然，思微念炁，时不亏闲，积感洞元，名超上清，受号元皇，位登紫晨，兰风应挺，顺运流迁，神秉五曜，形盘三元，飞霄回驾，乘空落烟，群仙启路三道合明，流电吐威，逸驾九玄，再登玉陛，三谒紫庭，游眄琼阙，宴景三元，携契五老，玉霄上宾，飞兽攘袂，神凤抚鸣，巨虬匡辔，灵风散香，流芬激扬，蓊蔼玉清，金童攀云而侍轮，玉女蹑虚而卫灵。
